title: Key error individuals when running refine labels
body:
I am using Windows 10 with Anaconda Env, DLC 2.1.3, Firefox. After training the network and analyzed a new video I tried to run the function extract_outlier_frames, and I got the following message:

```
Method  jump  found  1359  putative outlier frames.
Do you want to proceed with extracting  100  of those?
If this list is very large, perhaps consider changing the paramters (start, stop, epsilon, comparisonbodyparts) or use a different method.
yes/noyes

6it [00:00, 49.29it/s]

Frames from video Perturbation_8mm_17thApril_3_S20-04172020133320-0000  already extracted (more will be added)!
Loading video...
Duration of video [s]:  16.665 , recorded @  300.03000300030004 fps!
Overall # of frames:  5000 with (cropped) frame dimensions: 
Kmeans-quantization based extracting of frames from 0.0  seconds to 16.66  seconds.
Extracting and downsampling... 1359  frames from the video.

1359it [00:50, 26.89it/s]

Kmeans clustering ... (this might take a while)
Let's select frames indices: [673, 1915, 1564, 1690, 2892, 1637, 2295, 370, 1621, 1362, 1861, 1110, 4815, 1535, 4778, 1586, 2551, 3399, 4870, 1490, 1978, 189, 2143, 1969, 1944, 2445, 798, 2290, 2398, 1837, 2263, 2468, 965, 3660, 1244, 1610, 4821, 2189, 1961, 2435, 1872, 898, 1554, 1994, 4725, 1922, 1580, 646, 1290, 1710, 4939, 964, 2565, 1843, 3369, 1917, 2458, 937, 1207, 1355, 380, 490, 1734, 1310, 1294, 3, 1213, 425, 1650, 1728, 206, 1447, 1658, 1067, 1122, 1007, 844, 824, 4958, 1412, 923, 743, 301, 4897, 1330, 1542, 774, 2586, 144, 440, 400, 454, 153, 1227, 1477, 1687, 180, 1909, 532]
Creating the symbolic link of the video
AUTOMATIC ADDING OF VIDEO TO CONFIG FILE FAILED! You need to do this manually for including it in the config.yaml file!
Videopath: C:/Users/Salvo/Desktop/Ridge/DLC_videos/Videos_to_analyzeDLC/Ridge_MiceS20-S24_16thApril/perturbation_8mm_2/3_S20/Perturbation_8mm_17thApril_3_S20-04172020133320-0000.avi Coordinates for cropping: (200, 550, 50, 500)
The outlier frames are extracted. They are stored in the subdirectory labeled-data\Perturbation_8mm_17thApril_3_S20-04172020133320-0000.
Once you extracted frames for all videos, use 'refine_labels' to manually correct the labels.

C:\Users\Salvo\Anaconda3\envs\dlc-windowsGPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\refine_training_dataset\outlier_frames.py:368: FutureWarning: 
.ix is deprecated. Please use
.loc for label based indexing or
.iloc for positional indexing

See the documentation here:
http://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/user_guide/indexing.html#ix-indexer-is-deprecated
  DF = Dataframe.ix[frames2pick]

```

So after checking whether the outlier frames were saved in the subfolder, I tried to run the function 'refine_labels', but I get the error KeyError: 'individuals'.  I tried to re-run the notebook files, or run the function on other videos, but no luck, do you have any suggestions?
